newsitem.title: CHINA: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mostly down.
newsitem.headline: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mostly down.

text.p: Following is the China Interbank Offered Rate (CHIBOR) for Tuesday issued by the official Xinhua news agency on behalf of the People's Bank of China, the central bank.
The figures represent weighted averages and not closing prices and are annual percentage rates.
Turnover surged to 3.75 billion yuan from 1.607 billion yuan on Monday with the seven-day contract the most active.
"The new issues and listings on the domestic A share market today were the key factors for the surge in volume," one local trader said.
One company issued shares and two listed on the A share market.
Traders said continued gains on the A shares seemed to be another factor support rates, especially the early-maturing contracts.
Shanghai's A share index rose 4.477 points or 0.37 percent to 1,217.230 points on volume of 977.8 million shares worth 11.9 billion yuan.
But if the A share index cannot maintain its upward trend, the rates for early-maturing contracts are likely to face a correction in the next few days, traders said.

The gap between the interbank rates and the repo rates will encourage more non-banking financial institutions to enter the interbank market if the repo rates continue to move at high levels over the next few days, they said.
